_meta.description: Shared threat matrix — single source of truth for both Classical (ONI 14-Layer) and Quantum (QIF 7-Band Hourglass) models

Κ.name: Common
Κ.label: Common/Invariant
Κ.description: Elements shared across both ONI and QIF models

sources: threats.py — 7 predefined threat signatures, Kohno taxonomy
config.py THREAT_MODEL — 12 attack types with quantum detection
Microsoft STRIDE threat model — Spoofing, Tampering, Repudiation, Information Disclosure, Denial of Service, Elevation of Privilege

tactics.name: Reconnaissance
tactics.description: Gathering information about the target BCI system

techniques.name: Signal Profiling
techniques.description: Passive monitoring and analysis of neural signal patterns to understand communication protocols, timing characteristics, and signal baselines.

mitigations: Deploy RF shielding for wireless BCIs
detection: RF Monitoring: Detect unauthorized receivers
Signal Analysis: Identify unusual monitoring patterns

quantum.quantum_advantage: Phase coherence verification detects passive profiling — Heisenberg disturbance reveals observation

techniques.name: Side-Channel Analysis
techniques.description: Extracting sensitive information through timing variations, power consumption patterns, or electromagnetic emissions from BCI hardware.

mitigations: Use EM shielding on sensitive components
detection: Power Monitoring: Detect unusual power consumption probes
EM Scanning: Identify unauthorized EM measurement devices

quantum.quantum_advantage: Cross-band signal correlation reveals side-channel leakage patterns invisible to single-layer analysis

shared.academic_reference: Bonaci et al. (2015) demonstrated side-channel attacks on consumer EEG devices

techniques.name: Network Mapping
techniques.description: Discovering the topology of BCI node networks, identifying communication pathways between electrodes, processing units, and external interfaces.

detection: Network Monitor: Detect scanning patterns
L8 Firewall: Log enumeration attempts

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum-aware network segmentation limits topology exposure

tactics.name: Initial Access
tactics.description: Techniques to gain initial foothold in the BCI system

techniques.name: Electrode Compromise
techniques.description: Physical manipulation or replacement of neural electrodes to inject malicious signals or intercept legitimate neural data at the hardware level.

detection: Impedance Check: Detect electrode tampering via impedance changes
Physical Security: Monitor for unauthorized access

quantum.quantum_advantage: Coherence metric detects foreign electrode signatures through phase mismatch

techniques.name: RF Protocol Exploitation
techniques.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in wireless BCI communication protocols to gain unauthorized access to the neural interface system.

detection: RF Monitor: Detect protocol anomalies
L8 Firewall: Block unauthorized protocol messages

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum key distribution prevents protocol-level eavesdropping

techniques.name: Firmware Backdoor
techniques.description: Compromising BCI firmware through supply chain attacks or update mechanisms to establish persistent unauthorized access.

detection: Firmware Audit: Compare against known-good hashes
Behavioral Analysis: Detect unexpected firmware behavior

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum-based firmware attestation prevents supply chain compromise

techniques.name: Wireless Authentication Bypass
techniques.description: Exploiting weak or absent authentication on BCI wireless interfaces. Many older devices assume connection implies authorization.

detection: Authentication Monitor: Detect unauthenticated connections

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum authentication protocols prevent replay and bypass attacks

shared.academic_reference: Schroder et al. (2025) Yale Digital Ethics Center

techniques.name: Unencrypted Data Interception
techniques.description: Intercepting unencrypted neural data in transit. Most BCIs lack encryption due to power constraints.

detection: Traffic Analysis: Detect plaintext neural data transmission

quantum.quantum_advantage: QKD provides information-theoretically secure key exchange

shared.academic_reference: Schroder et al. (2025) Yale Digital Ethics Center

tactics.name: Execution
tactics.description: Running malicious signals or commands in the BCI

techniques.name: Signal Injection
techniques.description: Injecting crafted neural signals that mimic legitimate brain activity to trigger unauthorized actions or corrupt neural processing.

mitigations: Implement coherence validation at L8 (Cₛ threshold)
Deploy anomaly detection on signal patterns
detection: Coherence Metric: Detect signals with abnormal Cₛ scores
Pattern Analysis: Identify non-biological signal characteristics

quantum.quantum_advantage: Full QI(t) score detects injected signals that pass classical coherence checks

techniques.name: Protocol Manipulation
techniques.description: Exploiting weaknesses in neural data protocols to inject commands or alter data formatting in ways that bypass security controls.

detection: Protocol Monitor: Detect malformed protocol messages
L10 Validation: Flag protocol violations

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum-aware protocol validation detects temporal anomalies

techniques.name: Command Hijacking
techniques.description: Intercepting and modifying motor commands or cognitive instructions as they transit through the BCI system.

detection: Command Audit: Verify command source and integrity
Behavioral Check: Detect commands inconsistent with user intent

quantum.quantum_advantage: QI(t) score combined with intent-coherence detects hijacked commands

tactics.name: Persistence
tactics.description: Maintaining access to the compromised BCI system across sessions

techniques.name: Pattern Lock
techniques.description: Embedding recurring attack patterns that survive system resets by exploiting learned neural pathways or stored calibration data.

detection: Pattern Analysis: Detect unauthorized pattern modifications
Calibration Check: Verify calibration data integrity

quantum.quantum_advantage: Cross-session coherence baseline detects embedded patterns

techniques.name: Memory Implant
techniques.description: Persistent modification of neural pathway configurations or cognitive associations that survive across sessions.

detection: State Comparison: Detect unexpected cognitive state changes
Session Analysis: Identify cross-session anomalies

quantum.quantum_advantage: QI(t) baseline drift detection reveals persistent neural modifications

techniques.name: Calibration Poisoning
techniques.description: Subtly corrupting BCI calibration data to maintain influence over signal interpretation across device resets.

detection: Calibration Audit: Compare against baseline calibration
Performance Monitor: Detect calibration drift

quantum.quantum_advantage: Coherence metric detects calibration drift that classical methods miss

tactics.name: Defense Evasion
tactics.description: Avoiding detection by BCI security systems

techniques.name: Coherence Mimicry
techniques.description: Crafting malicious signals that maintain legitimate coherence scores (Cₛ) to bypass the Neural Firewall's signal validation.

detection: Behavioral Analysis: Detect signals with unusual context
Ensemble Detection: Use multiple validation metrics

quantum.detection: Enhanced (full QI(t) — quantum terms resist mimicry)
quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum indeterminacy terms (Qi, Qentangle) cannot be classically spoofed — the attacker cannot fake quantum noise

techniques.name: Gradual Drift
techniques.description: Slowly modifying neural parameters below detection thresholds to accumulate significant changes over time.

detection: Trend Analysis: Detect slow parameter drift
Baseline Comparison: Compare against historical baselines

quantum.quantum_advantage: Decoherence function ΓD(t) tracking detects subtle drift in quantum regime

techniques.name: Noise Injection
techniques.description: Adding carefully calibrated noise to mask malicious signal components from detection algorithms.

detection: Noise Analysis: Detect unusual noise patterns
Multi-Channel: Cross-validate across channels

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum noise has distinct statistical signature — injected classical noise is detectable

tactics.name: Collection
tactics.description: Gathering sensitive neural data from the BCI

techniques.name: ERP Harvesting
techniques.description: Extracting event-related potentials (P300, N170, N400) that reveal cognitive states, recognition, and decision-making processes.

detection: ERP Monitor: Detect unusual ERP extraction patterns
Data Flow Analysis: Track ERP data destinations

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum biometric identity verification prevents unauthorized ERP extraction

shared.academic_reference: Bonaci et al. (2015) demonstrated P300-based attacks on consumer BCIs

techniques.name: Cognitive State Capture
techniques.description: Recording patterns that reveal attention, emotion, fatigue, or other cognitive states without user awareness.

detection: Privacy Monitor: Detect unauthorized state inference
Data Audit: Review cognitive data collection

quantum.quantum_advantage: Privacy-preserving quantum measurement limits state inference

techniques.name: Memory Extraction
techniques.description: Attempting to extract memory-related neural patterns that could reveal personal experiences, knowledge, or intentions.

detection: Memory Monitor: Detect hippocampal signal extraction
Access Audit: Log all memory-related data access

quantum.quantum_advantage: No-cloning theorem prevents perfect copy of quantum neural state

tactics.name: Impact
tactics.description: Causing harm through the compromised BCI

techniques.name: Neural Denial of Service
techniques.description: Overwhelming neural pathways with excessive stimulation or signal flooding to cause temporary dysfunction or distress.

detection: Rate Monitor: Detect signal flooding
L8 Firewall: Block excessive traffic

quantum.quantum_advantage: Real-time QI(t) monitoring triggers emergency shutoff on anomalous drops

techniques.name: Motor Hijacking
techniques.description: Forcing involuntary motor actions by injecting false motor commands through compromised BCI motor interfaces.

detection: Intent Verification: Compare commands to detected intent
Motor Monitor: Detect unauthorized motor signals

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum-aware intent verification detects hijacked motor commands

shared.academic_reference: Schroder et al. (2025) — AI-mediated malicious stimulation scenario

techniques.name: Identity Erosion
techniques.description: Long-term subtle manipulation of cognitive patterns leading to gradual personality changes or identity confusion.

detection: Identity Monitor: Track identity markers over time
Behavioral Analysis: Detect personality drift

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum biometric baseline detects identity drift that classical behavioral analysis misses

techniques.name: Mass Neural Manipulation
techniques.description: Coordinated attack on standardized BCI systems affecting millions simultaneously. Yale's worst-case scenario.

detection: Population Monitor: Detect coordinated anomalies across devices

quantum.quantum_advantage: Population-level QI(t) anomaly detection reveals coordinated attacks

shared.academic_reference: Schroder et al. (2025) — Yale Digital Ethics Center worst-case scenario

tactics.name: Quantum-Specific Threats
tactics.description: Attack vectors unique to or enhanced by quantum computing capabilities

techniques.name: Eavesdropping (Quantum)
techniques.description: Attempting to intercept neural signals at the quantum level. Detectable via Heisenberg disturbance principle.

quantum.quantum_advantage: Any measurement disturbs quantum state — eavesdropping is inherently detectable

techniques.name: Man-in-the-Middle (Quantum)
techniques.description: Intercepting and relaying neural signals between electrode and brain. Defeated by no-cloning theorem and Bell tests.

quantum.quantum_advantage: No-cloning theorem prevents perfect signal duplication; Bell tests detect interception

techniques.name: Quantum Tunneling Exploit
techniques.description: Exploiting quantum tunneling at the ion-channel level to bypass classical security barriers.

quantum.quantum_advantage: Tunneling traversal time profiles are unique per individual — anomalies detectable

techniques.name: Davydov Soliton Attack
techniques.description: Exploiting Davydov soliton propagation in protein structures to trigger false synaptic events.

quantum.quantum_advantage: Qtunnel term in QI equation detects non-biological soliton signatures

techniques.name: Harvest-Now-Decrypt-Later
techniques.description: Capturing encrypted neural data now for decryption when quantum computers become available.

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum key distribution provides information-theoretic security — no future quantum computer can break it

techniques.name: Identity Spoofing (Quantum)
techniques.description: Attempting to spoof neural biometric identity markers to impersonate a BCI user.

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum biometric identity is unforgeable — entanglement patterns are unique and unclonable

tactics.name: Infrastructure Attacks
tactics.description: Attacks targeting BCI supporting infrastructure (silicon domain)

techniques.name: BLE/RF Side-Channel
techniques.description: Exploiting Bluetooth Low Energy or RF side channels in BCI wireless communication.

detection: RF Monitor: Detect side-channel emissions

quantum.quantum_advantage: Cross-band signal correlation analysis detects correlated side-channel leakage

techniques.name: Supply Chain Compromise
techniques.description: Compromising BCI hardware or software during manufacturing or distribution.

detection: Firmware Attestation: Verify hardware/software integrity

quantum.quantum_advantage: Quantum-based firmware attestation provides tamper-evident verification

techniques.name: Cloud Infrastructure Attack
techniques.description: Compromising cloud services used for BCI data processing, storage, or model training.

detection: Cloud Monitor: Detect unauthorized access patterns

quantum.quantum_advantage: QKD secures cloud communication channels against quantum adversaries

techniques.name: Neural Data Privacy Breach
techniques.description: Unauthorized access to stored or transmitted neural data across multiple system layers.

detection: Privacy Monitor: Detect unauthorized data access across layers

quantum.quantum_advantage: Cross-band quantum encryption prevents data exposure at any layer

defenses.name: Coherence Metric Validation
defenses.description: Signal trust scoring using phase, temporal, and cross-channel coherence

classical.mechanism: Neural Gateway firewall — Cₛ threshold check

quantum.mechanism: Full QI(t) score incorporating quantum terms

shared.decision: ACCEPT if Cₛ > 0.6; FLAG if 0.3-0.6; REJECT if < 0.3

defenses.name: BCI Anonymizer
defenses.description: Privacy-preserving signal processing that removes identity-revealing ERP components

classical.mechanism: ERP component filtering at cognitive layers

shared.decision: Filter identity-revealing components before signal output

defenses.name: Quantum Key Distribution (QKD)
defenses.description: Information-theoretically secure key exchange for BCI communications

classical.mechanism: Classical encryption (AES-256, RSA — vulnerable to quantum)

shared.decision: Use QKD for all key exchange; fall back to PQC if QKD unavailable

defenses.name: Emergency Shutoff
defenses.description: Hardware-level safety mechanism for critical threat detection

classical.mechanism: Rate limiting and circuit breaker at Neural Gateway

quantum.mechanism: QI(t) critical threshold triggers hardware shutoff

shared.decision: EMERGENCY_SHUTOFF if Cₛ < 0.3 with severity CRITICAL

defenses.name: Quantum Biometric Identity
defenses.description: Unforgeable identity verification using quantum neural signatures

quantum.mechanism: Quantum entanglement patterns as identity marker

shared.decision: Verify identity through quantum biometric before granting access

defenses.name: Tunneling Profile Authentication
defenses.description: Using individual ion-channel tunneling profiles as a security primitive

shared.decision: Authenticate electrode-neuron interface via tunneling profile

neurorights.name: Mental Integrity
neurorights.description: Right to protection against unauthorized modification of neural activity

neurorights.name: Cognitive Liberty
neurorights.description: Right to freedom of thought and cognitive self-determination

neurorights.name: Psychological Continuity
neurorights.description: Right to preservation of personal identity and psychological coherence
